Package ohos.sensor.bean

Class CategoryBody

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.sensor.bean.SensorBase
      • ohos.sensor.bean.CategoryBody

  • public class CategoryBody
extends SensorBase
    Inherits from SensorBase and describes body sensors on hardware devices.

    This class describes the sensor types in the body category, such as the heart rate sensors. It also provides the method for constructing a CategoryBody instance.

    Since:
    3
    See Also:
    SensorBase
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Sensors#SENSOR

    • Field Detail

      • SENSOR_TYPE_HEART_RATE

        public static final int SENSOR_TYPE_HEART_RATE
        An integer representing the heart rate sensor type.

        Heart rate sensors are used to monitor users' health status. A heart rate sensor records a user's heart rate data and returns the number of heartbeats per minute. Before subscribing to this sensor, the application needs to request the ohos.permission.READ_HEALTH_DATA permission.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • CategoryBody

        public CategoryBody​(int sensorId,
                    String name,
                    String vendor,
                    int version,
                    float upperRange,
                    float resolution,
                    int flags,
                    int cacheMaxCount,
                    long minInterval,
                    long maxInterval)
        A constructor used to create a CategoryBody instance.
        Parameters:
        sensorId - Indicates the ID of the sensor.
        name - Indicates the name of the sensor.
        vendor - Indicates the manufacturer of the sensor.
        version - Indicates the version of the sensor.
        upperRange - Indicates the maximum measurement range of the sensor.
        resolution - Indicates the resolution of the sensor.
        flags - Indicates the flags of the sensor.
        cacheMaxCount - Indicates the maximum number of hardware FIFO elements supported by the sensor.
        minInterval - Indicates the minimum sampling interval of the sensor, in nanoseconds.
        maxInterval - Indicates the maximum sampling interval of the sensor, in nanoseconds.
        Since:
        3
